Package space.sunqian.fs.net.udp

Interface UdpSender

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable
public interface UdpSender extends Cloneable
This interface is used to send UDP data.

  • Method Details

    • newSender

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull UdpSender newSender() throws NetException
      Returns a new UDP sender which disables broadcast. This method is equivalent to newSender(false).
      Returns:
      a new UDP sender
      Throws:
      NetException - if an error occurs

    • newSender

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull UdpSender newSender(boolean broadcast) throws NetException
      Returns a new UDP sender. The parameter broadcast determines whether to enable broadcast, the broadcast method can only be used when the broadcast is enabled.
      Parameters:
      broadcast - whether to enable broadcast
      Returns:
      a new UDP sender
      Throws:
      NetException - if an error occurs

    • sendData

      void sendData(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer data, @Nonnull @Nonnull SocketAddress address) throws NetException
      Sends buffer data to the specified address.
      Parameters:
      data - the buffer data to be sent, its position will increment by the number of actual bytes sent
      address - the specified address to send to
      Throws:
      NetException - if an error occurs

    • sendData

      default void sendData(byte @Nonnull [] data, @Nonnull @Nonnull SocketAddress address) throws NetException
      Sends data to the specified address.
      Parameters:
      data - the data to be sent
      address - the specified address to send to
      Throws:
      NetException - if an error occurs

    • sendString

      default void sendString(@Nonnull @Nonnull String str, @Nonnull @Nonnull SocketAddress address) throws NetException
      Sends data to the specified address. The string will be encoded using CharsKit.defaultCharset().
      Parameters:
      str - the string to be sent
      address - the specified address to send to
      Throws:
      NetException - if an error occurs

    • sendString

      default void sendString(@Nonnull @Nonnull String str, @Nonnull @Nonnull Charset charset, @Nonnull @Nonnull SocketAddress address) throws NetException
      Sends string to the specified address. The string will be encoded using the specified charset.
      Parameters:
      str - the string to be sent
      charset - the charset to encode the string
      address - the specified address to send to
      Throws:
      NetException - if an error occurs

    • sendPacket

      default void sendPacket(@Nonnull @Nonnull DatagramPacket packet) throws NetException
      Sends the given datagram packet.
      Parameters:
      packet - the given datagram packet
      Throws:
      NetException - if an error occurs

    • sendBroadcast

      default void sendBroadcast(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer data, int port) throws NetException
      Sends a local broadcast, the content of the broadcast is the given byte buffer.
      Parameters:
      data - the given byte buffer to be sent, its position will increment by the number of actual bytes sent
      port - the port of the broadcast
      Throws:
      NetException - if the broadcast is disabled, or an error occurs

    • sendBroadcast

      default void sendBroadcast(byte @Nonnull [] data, int port) throws NetException
      Sends a local broadcast, the content of the broadcast is the given byte array.
      Parameters:
      data - the given byte array to be sent
      port - the port of the broadcast
      Throws:
      NetException - if the broadcast is disabled, or an error occurs

    • sendBroadcast

      default void sendBroadcast(@Nonnull @Nonnull String str, int port) throws NetException
      Sends a local broadcast, the content of the broadcast is the given string. The string will be encoded using CharsKit.defaultCharset().
      Parameters:
      str - the given string to be sent
      port - the port of the broadcast
      Throws:
      NetException - if the broadcast is disabled, or an error occurs

    • sendBroadcast

      default void sendBroadcast(@Nonnull @Nonnull String str, @Nonnull @Nonnull Charset charset, int port) throws NetException
      Sends a local broadcast, the content of the broadcast is the given string. The string will be encoded using the specified charset.
      Parameters:
      str - the given string to be sent
      charset - the charset to encode the string
      port - the port of the broadcast
      Throws:
      NetException - if the broadcast is disabled, or an error occurs

      @Nonnull @Nonnull InetAddress broadcastAddress() throws NetException
      Returns the broadcast address.
      Returns:
      the broadcast address
      Throws:
      NetException - if the broadcast is disabled, or an error occurs

    • refreshBroadcastAddress

      @Nonnull @Nonnull InetAddress refreshBroadcastAddress() throws NetException
      Refreshes and returns the broadcast address.
      Returns:
      the broadcast address
      Throws:

    • close

      void close() throws NetException
      Closes this sender.
      Throws:
      NetException - if any error occurs

    • channel

      @Nonnull @Nonnull DatagramChannel channel()
      Returns the underlying channel that supports this sender.

      This method is used to provide high-performance (such as direct buffer) data transmission support, and any modifications to the underlying channel will affect the sender.

      Returns:
      the underlying channel that supports this sender
